intro: Silphium edule, commonly known as the fennel plant, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its hollow, ridged stems and feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Silphium edule is known for its aromatic seeds and roots, which have been used historically for their medicinal and culinary properties. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats.
